SEARCH
Package view

Interface TTTView

public interface TTTView
The TTTView interface defines methods for displaying the game state and interacting with the user. It abstracts the input/output operations, allowing the Controller to interact with different types of views (e.g., text-based, GUI, mock views for testing) without knowing the implementation details.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    displayBoard(Player[][] board)
    Displays the current state of the board to the user.
    int[]
    getUserMove()
    Prompts the user to enter their next move and returns it as a pair of coordinates.
    void
    showGameResult(Player winner)
    Displays the game result, indicating the winner or if the game is a draw.
    void
    showMessage(String message)
    Displays a message to the user.

  • Method Details

    • displayBoard

      void displayBoard(Player[][] board)
      Displays the current state of the board to the user.
      Parameters:
      board - A 2D array of Player representing the current board state. Each element can be Player.X, Player.O, or Player.EMPTY.

    • getUserMove

      int[] getUserMove()
      Prompts the user to enter their next move and returns it as a pair of coordinates.
      Returns:
      An array of two integers, where the first element is the row index and the second is the column index.

    • showMessage

      void showMessage(String message)
      Displays a message to the user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed.

    • showGameResult

      void showGameResult(Player winner)
      Displays the game result, indicating the winner or if the game is a draw.
      Parameters:
      winner - The Player who won the game, or Player.EMPTY if it was a draw.
